Reviews.Title: “A cute and cozy place”
Reviews.Author: aprilpyo
Reviews.Content: hotel is clean and quiet but room was so small and compact for a family of three, also bathroom was so small and no door in shower, so we have to clean the floor everytime shower since water splashed all over. We couldn't see the eiffel tower from the room but could see the beaming light from the tower at night and nice location, Rue cler is just around corner so we could easily access to shops and main attractions. The breakfast was nice, the staff were friendly and helpful. Overall a cute and cozy place. We wouldnt mind going back.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: djlund999
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in mid-March. Very enjoyable. Rooms were very clean, with modern designs and new features. In a great neighborhood (Rue Claire is a true micro-village in the heart of Paris). Staff was responsive and helpful, and the chocolate bar was unique. (Relatievly) affordable for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Alise J
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the end of February and it was fantastic. Hotel is very clean and our room was serviced every day. Staff is extremely helpful, friendly and polite. Also. the location is great! Definitely will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: rhoda f
Reviews.Content: Stayed st this friendly and welcoming hotel. Was not too big but served its purpose. Had a good nights sleep and close to Eiffel tower. We couldn't see the Eiffel tower from our room but the walk wasn't long. Rooms were nice and compact our phone couldn't dial out to the other rooms but younger wat ya pay for!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Paris hotel near to Effiel Tower”
Reviews.Author: lan18
Reviews.Content: Check-in for the hotel is across the street in Hotel Cadran. The reception is friendly, and you get your room card and a pin to access Hotel Valadon. In Hotel Valadon, there is a sitting area and coffee-making facitlities on the main foyer, which you could help youself to a drink anytime. We booked 3 rooms, 2 standard and 1 family room. The standard rooms are big for a Paris hotel, but the family room is the same sized and when because the sofa is pulled out into a bed, there is practically no walking space and you literally could not open your luggage. For family, it is more advisable to book seperate standard rooms instead. As there are only 2 rooms on each floor, its like the whole floor is yours anyway and you get more space. The rooms are relatively clean. Bathroom is small, with a shower and small wash area. There is free WIFI provided at the hotel, and breakfast is included in the price as well although you have to take your breakfast in Hotel Cadran's basement. Overall, the best experience I have had in my 3 visits to Paris. Would stay here again the next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Location fantastic, room cleanliness not so much, good hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Ntoulp
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, it was obvious that the bedding had been used (lots of hair on the sheets and the inside of the duvet cover). So we called the reception and asked to have them changed and went out to grab some dinner. When we returned, we found clean sheets on the bed but they had not been changed. We called the reception and we were told we had to change them ourselves. We thought its not a big deal and we did, leaving the dirty sheets on the floor next to the bathroom door. For the next three days the dirty sheers remained there as the cleaners never bothered to remove them! Other than that, the location is truly fantastic and the room size is ok, Paris standards. Breakfast is acceptable too and people at reception very helpful in general.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further!”
Reviews.Author: Caspy_11
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, with excellent rooms and perfect location. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Paris for the price!”
Reviews.Author: bmteacher25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Valadon Colors from November 23-27, 2011 and couldn't have been happier! We stayed in room 40 and it took us a minute to figure out that there was a small entry room before our actual room door (anyone watching us trying to figure out where to put the key would have laughed)! :) There were two twin beds that pushed together to make one large bed that was perfect size - much better than the double bed we were used to having in Europe! The room had great windows that gave wonderful light during the day and overlooked the little street. Looked brand new and very clean/modern. There was construction going on in a building next to us, so we got woken up early in the morning by lots of noise, even with the windows closed. I would suggest a room off the street if you are a light sleeper, but the front desk was willing to move us to the main hotel (which is where the reception desk and breakfast are) if we wanted, which we decided not to do since we really did like our room. We sure did appreciate the offer, though! The desk was also extremely helpful when we were having trouble purchasing some tickets online - wonderful people every time we needed anything. There was also two computers with internet and a printer in the main hotel lobby, which was nice since we didn't bring a computer. We did have great free WiFi in our room, though, that we used with my iPhone. The best part about this hotel was the LOCATION! It is right by a metro stop (Ecole Militaire on the #8 route) and only about a 10-15 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. It is also right off the little Rue Cler neighborhood with several great restaurants and tons of little shops right around the corner. The price was unbelievable for the location/quality (we paid $138 Euro per night) and I would most definitely return to this hotel (and city)!

Reviews.Title: “Cute and modern hotel near the Eiffel Tower!!”
Reviews.Author: Kara434
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just off Rue Cler and about 10 minutes walking distance from the Eiffel Tower. We stayed in a triple room at the Hotel Valadon Colors and it was so cute! Tiny room but completely updated with a very relaxed feel. If you don't mind a small room (good luck finding a large one in Paris) ... this hotel is a must! Also - the front desk was very helpful. We could not plug our US hair straightner into the European outlet, but the front desk had a straightner we borrowed!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: CPJHKH
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel just off Rue Cler. Small rooms but clean. OK storage space. Street-facing rooms are noisy, especially weekend nights. Inside rooms very quiet. Breakfast at sister restaurant diagonally across street was a very good value and more nutritious/healthful than a baguette and coffee (yogurt, granola, cereals, soft boiled eggs, fruit, croissant). Stay away from the "triple room cottage" as it would rate average to poor (they tried to put us in that room first). Good location: 15min walk to Eiffel, 1 min to bus 69 route, 5 min walk to Metro. Many restaurants/cafes/shops around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat”
Reviews.Author: DineFrequently
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through a friend. It is newly renovated so modern and clean. The rooms are quite small but very well equipped. Only drawback was no safe. Staff were all very helpful and spoke English willingly.Breakfast was good as was the price. The Christoph store at the Hotel Cadran next door is devilishly good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the heart of Rue Cler!”
Reviews.Author: CasReds
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Valadon the first week of September and had a wonderful stay. The Valadon, owned by nearby Hotel Cadran, was quiet and peaceful, and just one street over from Rue Cler. The room was plenty big enough for two of us, nicely decorated with a clean and big enough bathroom/shower. Our only gripe on the place was the lack of a mini-fridge. Being so close to Rue Cler and the wonderful food shops, it would have been nice to have some refrigerated storage space! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Character, location and charm.”
Reviews.Author: terryLumsden
Reviews.Content: From the first contact via email, to the time the shuttle dropped my daughter (13) and myself at the Gare du Nord 5 the staff were helpful, kind and cheerful. Celine and Marta made sure we had all the information needed to make the most of our stay in Paris. Not my first time in the city but my best hotel experience. A tiny 12 room hotel one block from the pedestrian market street of Rue Cler, 7 minutes walk from the Champs du Mars and Eiffel Tower, breakfast a couple of houses down the street in the 'mother hotel'. Warmly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caltortay
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the cottage in the courtyard, which is 2 connecting rooms. Great space for a family of 5, absolutely ideal. The staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke fluent English despite my efforts at bad schoolboy french. Breakfast is over the road in the main hotel and is delicious, staff again very helpful and free sweets for the kids a nice touch. Location is excellent, short walk to the Eiffel Tower and lots of bars, restaurants and shops just round the corner. Metro 2 min walk. A great small, friendly hotel which I would very highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A great location, but one member of staff spoilt our stay”
Reviews.Author: nelliejane
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we had stayed at this hotel and we were very impressed with the refurbishment. The young man on check-in was very welcoming and the fact that the main reception was at the Cadran across the road was not a problem. The gift of macaroons was a lovely touch. However... on our first morning for breakfast we had a problem finding the breakfast room at the Cadran (along with a couple of other guests). Reception was busy (understandable) but a woman, who we think might have been the manageress, deliberately ignored us as we wandered around trying to find out where to go, she was busy having an altercation with another member of staff at the office desk. The next day we retuned back to the hotel after a long day sightseeing to discover (at 8.00pm) the towels had been taken from the room and not replaced. As we wanted to shower before dinner we went over to the Cadran and explained to the young man on reception. Before he could answer the aggressive "manageress" in the side office told us that the hotel was full and the towels not ready and we would have to wait. We tried to explain to the young man again that we needed a shower, even just one towel would do, but the woman interrupted again and said she had already explained and we would have to wait. The young man decided to help us despite the manageress and went to find us a set of towels, much to her annoyance. What a shame her attitude was so unfriendly and unhelpful because all the other staff under her were super and helpful, but it really upset us. I think for the price we paid, a towel for the evening is a minimum requirement no matter how busy the hotel is. We were also disappointed that in the Valadon reception the milk supplies were not regularly replaced for the coffee machine so we never managed to get a drink in the morning or the evening as there are no facilities in the room. To finish on a positive note, as I have never complained about a hotel before, the breakfast was really great, as were the breakfast room staff, the bedroom and bathroom were immaculate and well decorated. The location is also fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Would come back to stay!”
Reviews.Author: bulldogs27
Reviews.Content: The location was only a couple minutes walk to the Eiffel tower, the Siene, the Metro stop, and right next to Rue Cler, which has delicious food choices (Amorino, crepes, croissants, market with fresh fruit). The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was perfect for the two of us, clean and modern bathroom, really comfortable bedding. Wireless was available through the Cadran hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY THERE IF YOU HAVE A PLANE TO CATCH!!!”
Reviews.Author: nenhum_11
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at this hotel only for one night. We checked out and asked for a transfer to CDG airport. The shuttle never showed up. We stayed waiting for one hour and almost lost our flight. In the end, we took a taxi that was much more expensive. And more: we asked the front desk to call the shuttle and they always said that 'it was coming'... So, if you have a plane to catch, dont stay at this hotel or, at least, dont ask for their help on your transport. The hotel itself is very expensive and simple. When we arrived, there was noone at the front desk. You have to go to another hotel (cadran) where you can check in while your luggage stay at the street. Breakfast is also in this other hotel. There is no privacy in the batrhroom, the sink is in the middle of the room, like a hostel! Wifi internet did not work in our room, You have to go to the stairs to make it work. Poor!! Terrible service! I will never stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Staff! Must stay!”
Reviews.Author: levelia
Reviews.Content: We books this hotel because it was referred to us by a friend., and we are SO glad we did! Absolutely NO COMPLAINTS! For our first trip to Paris the hotel and staff were a great decision. They had just remodeled the rooms a month before our stay. Our room was on the top 5th floor. The room was fabulous! We even got a view of the tip top of the Eiffel Tower just enough to see it sparkle at night! The rooms were clean, big beads, great updated bathrooms and very quiet. We hardly spent time in the room, so for us the room was perfect to come in after a long day of sightseeing and relax. The front desk staff was very helpful and let us book a shuttle to an from the airport for only $60. I highly recommend doing this, as it is much cheaper then a cab through all of the traffic! The shuttle is dependable, on time and fast. The hotel is located near a grocery store, plenty of different cafe's and bakeries, YUM! Its definitely within 10min to the Eiffel Tower. We actually walked to all of our destinations from this hotel - the Louvre, Luxembourg Gardens, Champs Ellysees, etc. But we are more of the foot travel type to really get to experience the culture so some may not want to do that. All and all this is a great hotel with a helpful and friendly staff for our first trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: UnicoTrebbiano
Reviews.Content: Valadon Colors delivers my expectations; an inviting stay and quality. Pros Helpful friendly staff Hotel looks new or renovated Very comfortable beds Lovely location Cons Rooms 2 is like a small apartment, but the ceilings at some parts are quite low (whatch yor head)

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: TCUNC76
Reviews.Content: I have like many been ..traveling to France & Paris for years..Always starting my time in Normandy for the D-Day ceremonies and then back to Paris for some time there. The Hotel Valadon is located off the well know Rue Cler Market Street in the 7th. A very quite place to stay and relax after walking all over the beautiful streets & parks in Paris. Located close to the Metro & the great market street...Rue Cler. The Eiffel Tower & river are within easy walking distance. The Hotel has new ownership and they have done a nice job of remaking the rooms...love the new HD Flat Screen in my room. Very large bed & the bathrooms are very nice. The staff is most helpful and one can access the internet from the CADRAN Hotel right across the street. I been staying there for many years and find it a great place to relax and unwind after enjoying Paris . Looking forward to a return there next year .

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and next time in Paris we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Birgit66
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to Tour Eiffel, in a nice neighborhood with nice grocery shops and Cafes. Tastefully decorated rooms, with modern design and clean bathrooms. A really great breakfast buffet (nothing like we expected in Paris) with baguette, croissants, cereals, yoghurt, fresh fruit salat, juices, and a wonderful self service machine for cafe au lait, espresso.... And a very nice and friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Can recommend to all”
Reviews.Author: fordtraveler56
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with very good staff. Loved the location of this newly renovated hotel. Very quiet, modern and comfortable. We had a small problem with the shower overflowing and false fire alarm one morning. The shower was fixed in less than an hour and bottle of sparkling wine and a box of macarons were waiting for us that evening as an apology. Breakfast was to pricey for us but you can step just outside the hotel and get anything you want within minutes. Stay here you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: amc2276
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the Hotel Valadon for 2 nights in May 2011. The hotel is in a great location, within a few minutes walk from the metro station. there is also plenty of places nearby to eat, a few bars, and a supermarket right around the corner. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was very modern, clean, and nice. The free daily breakfast was yummy as well! You couldn't get a better deal for the price, which include free bfast and wifi. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again if I was in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: zippertravel
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our trip to Paris. We stayed at the Valadon for 7 days. I would definately recommend this hotel. It's location can't be beat. It's on a nice quiet street, with lots of nearby restaurants, bakeries and even a small grocery store. Everything you could ever want is near at hand. It's a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and close to a metro station. It makes a great home base. They were renovating while we were there, so things were improving as they went along - the handrail on the stairwell was a nice addition on day 3. Our room was newly renovated, very nicely done. A decent size room, smallish bathroom, but all in all larger than expected for a hotel that is in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Near Eiffel Tour, cute neighborhood, trendy decor.”
Reviews.Author: teporter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, and a friend of ours, stayed just one night at the Valadon, which I booked after reading other reviews. The pictures from TripAdvisor did not look anything like where we stayed though. It was much trendier and more fun! The hotel is newly renovated and our room was hot pink and gray with a great bathroom and really comfortable beds. The front desk staff was very friendly. As others have said, the hotel front desk is actually in another hotel just up the street where they give you a key card to get into the Valadon. It is located very close to the Ecole Militaire metro, and about a 10 minute walk to the grassy area that stretches in front of the Eiffel Tour. The neighborhood is really cute with lots of cafes, bakeries, and restaurants. For the price and the area, it was a great deal. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique comfort, amazing location & fantastic hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: kkkoj
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the comfort suite and to our surprise it was newly renovated when we arrived. The pictures of the previous design was still nice and we booked the hotel going on the great reviews of others who have stayed here. We were not disappointed! We were greeted with a very warm welcome in check-in at the Cadron Hotel across the street and were even given delicious chocolates! We also had two friends who stayed at the hotel at the same time in comfort suites as well and they were both also as impressed with the service, quality and value of the rooms. The room was GREAT! Beautiful, boutique design. Big bathroom with an open concept shower, spacious sleeping area with pull-out loveseat if required, comfortable bed, comforter and pillows, and awesome blackout drapes for a great night's sleep. We stayed for 3 nights and loved our stay. The hotel is a 2 minute walk to the Ecole Militaire metro and a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. Boulangeries/Patisseries, cafes, shops were just around the corner. What an amazing location for us as this was our first time in Parisl. We had arranged an airport shuttle which was arranged perfectly and had also called for a cab one evening to meet up with some friends for dinner; the stafff were always more than happy to help. The hotel staff were great; genuinely very nice, helpful and efficient! We would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to everyone! We loved our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “A delightful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frenchtraveller8
Reviews.Content: A couple of years ago we tried to book the Hotel Valadon but it was unavailable so this time we booked early and were not disappointed. The Valadon is now managed from the Hotel Cadran (open 24/7 with excellent reception girls) which is nearby but this does not pose any problems â€“ a swipe card allows you entry your building. When we arrived (early in the am) we were told that the Hotel Valadon was still undergoing refurbishment but that our room should be available later in the day. We then walked past the hotel and thought â€œno wayâ€� but it was all OK at the end of the day. We were absolutely delighted with our room on the 4th floor â€“ so very chic in its contemporary design â€“ lovely curved tiled walls in the bathroom flowed into a recess in the main room which contained a two seater couch and flat screen TV on the wall above. The bed was two long singles pushed together with separate luxurious fluffy doonas and two comfy pillows each â€“ beds were a little hard though. Lots of lighting and a great bathroom and unusual wall/ceiling decor in 3 segments, one of which was a wallpaper of a grey sky with clouds culminating in a floor to ceiling mirror. It wasnâ€™t a huge room but quite adequate for our needs. There were also two windows which opened to the street below but with the double glazing it was so very quiet when they were closed. The only negative was that the shower overflowed the recess and on mentioning this to reception we believe that this was going to be fixed. Oh and the lift was quite small â€“ only big enough for 2 suitcases and 1 person â€“ but then thatâ€™s Paris! We treat the exercise in using the stairs to offset some of the delectable food and good wine we have to excess while in Paris! To our delight we were given a lovely bottle of champagne and a box of artisan chocolates which were soooooo delicious for being the first guests in our new refurbished room. A lovely gesture â€“ thank you Hotel Valadon! The location is good â€“ next to Rue Cler which is an interesting cobbled street full of market produce, flower shops and restaurants and just around the corner from the Metro station Ecole Militaire. We recommend the Hotel Valadon and would be most happy to return there when next we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Tried to cancel in time and they still charged a late cancellation fee.”
Reviews.Author: susanlfern
Reviews.Content: I was unable to make the trip and contacted the hotel several times via email and they finally responded AFTER the 48-hour time to cancel so that they could charge me one nights stay. Pretty low of them. They said I was too late in canceling; they just ignored previous emails I have a record of them having received.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value - worth way more than 2 stars!!”
Reviews.Author: xena_mojo
Reviews.Content: I was so worried about whether I had made the right decision about the Valadon before I arrived. Would the pictures be true to form? Would it be as roomy as I was expectingt? Would it be clean and not dingy? I had emailed another trip advisor user who stayed at the Valadon and asked for recommendations - she said I would love the cottage, and she was right. We stayed in the cottage with 2 x 14 yr olds and 1 x 16 yr old. The rooms were spacious and clean. The bathrooms were huge. We had three other families of friends staying nearby in other hotels - our rooms were by far the biggest, with the bathrooms being 3 times the size of theirs. Their hotels were 3 stars and on average about $ 70 - 100 dearer per day, yet they all say ours was far superior and way better value for money.The privacy of the cottage was worth it;\'s weight in gold . We went out to Crazy Horse without our kids and they were very happy in their room and we didn't need to worry, as they were safely tucked away in the cottage. The downstairs area of the ground floor meant we could have our friends over and share a take away meal at the tables and chairs. This area also gave us a third toilet to use if needed. The wifi was great. The service from the Cadran staff was exceptional. We were given free macaroons and a bottle of champagne. Breakfast was soooooo good that we were spoilt - the best croissants I have ever tasted. The communication of staff via email before we left Australia was superb and their manner while we stayed was an absolute pleasure - so friendly and accommodating. This is a real gem of a place and such great value for money - budget price for great accommodation in a perfect location!!!!!!!!! I'd give it 6 stars if i could!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, basic rooms but spacious and clean.”
Reviews.Author: PinkyPearly
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, there are plenty of bars and restaurants around the corner and even more a couple of minutes walk away. There is a mini supermarket at the end of the small street the hotel is on. It was only a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and there is a metro station at the end of the main street. You have to check in and have breakfast at the Cadran hotel which is seconds away on foot but this proved no problems. The room was clean and spacious, the bathroom was a bit on the small side but there was still plenty of room to move around. The decor was a bit eighties in style but looked like it had been done recently. The bed was very comfy. When we return to Paris i think we may look at booking the Cadran as it is virtually the same location but looks like the rooms are less basic. The Valadon didn't have room service or a mini bar but the Cadran does. They are both owned by the same company. I would deffinately reccomend the Valadon as the price is quite resonable for the location. One of the downsides is that the walls are quite thin so you can here other guests but it didn't really impact massively on our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good if you are not with kids”
Reviews.Author: Rauz
Reviews.Content: As you can see from the other reviews, word has gotten around most English-speaking circles that this is an English friendly hotel in an English-speaking nighborhood of Paris. Thank you Rick Steves. As such, just about every English speaking family with "angelic" kids stays here. So bascially it's a daycare center in the French part of Epcot Center. Yes, the location is great and the hotel is okay, but if you really want a Parisian experience, there are so many other great neighborhoods and hotels aroujd. I would say this is a great place for families with young kids making their first trip to Paris. Seasoned travelers - or people wanting more of a relaxing adult experience - should stay away.

Reviews.Title: “good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: wong_number
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room for 3 adults.The room was very clean as was the common areas of the hotel.The elevator (lift) was fairly small,but I had read other reviews from people staying at other hotels that said the same thing.I also read reviews of other hotels that said the bathrooms were very small,but the bathroom and shower was very adequate and I am a little over 6 feet tall..The front desk and the main staff are at the Hotel Calaron (sister hotel) which is about a half a minute walk away.The staff are very very helpful and knowledgable.the Valadon is around the corner of the rue cler area..we were close to lots of good restaurants which had good food with lots of varietyThere was also grocery stores close by if you wanted to buy some wine or other food.almost everyone in the area spoke english so it was easy to get around.The bus and subway (train) were close by the hotel.the Eiffel Tower was within about a half an hour walk.People have to keep in mind that when you register at a 2 or 3 star hotel you should not expect a 5 star hotel.you are getting what you pay for .this hotel was good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, large rooms.”
Reviews.Author: dee_jay_ay
Reviews.Content: By the time we got to Paris we were used to European hotel rooms being only slightly larger than the beds, so we were very pleasantly surprised by the Valadon. The rooms was roomy and clean. The location was great, with a short walk to the Eiffel tower and lots of places nearby to eat. The front desk staff were exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “A little expensive but a very confortable room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There is a marchÃª on the corner, 100m away from the hotel, which is a great plus when you travel with a baby (my case). Two blocks away from the Metro in a charming neighborhood, with restaurants, cheese and flower stores just around the corner. The room was big for parisian standard. We stood at the family room in the back, which is accessible through an open area in the back on the ground floor. It means it gets Good light but has no view. If you plan to have a baby cart, a piece of advice: There are stairs to get to the room and space to carry it is narrow. Bathroom was spacious and water boiling hot. It is in the lower level through a steep stair. The room was clean and a crib for the baby was provided. One issue: the reception desk isn't at the hotel. It's actually at hotel cadron in the corner. There was no visible information we should go to the other hotel's service desk and it took us some minutes to realize it. Also, having a baby in the street untill finding out how to handle the situation for about 10 minutes wasn't really enjoyable. (reason for my "avarage" review on "Service". But after this first episode, no other issues happened.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alex63Como
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the family cottage which consists of two connecting rooms on different levels This is a very convenient accommodation for large groups. The rooms are nice and the bathrooms very large and brand new. The bed was really very comfortable. The place is quiet, no noise is heard during the night, but I have to say that due to this â€œprotectedâ€� position inside a courtyard there is no view at all onto outside. If you want to have an eye on Paris from your room do not choose this accommodation. We were travelling with a 2 year old boy and I have to say that all the personnel was very helpful, many times during the day we had to boil the milk for the baby and the polite girl at the bar was always willing and available to help us (despite our bad French). This hotel is very close to Eiffel Tower, only 10 minute walk. I confirm all the positive comments made by other guests and would recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: Philly2010
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I greatly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Valadon. It is in a great location, which is walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and other sites. It was also very conveniently located near the Ecole Militaire Metro Station. The room was nicely decorated and provided enough space for 2 people. The front desk staff was also very helpful. They assisted us with booking tickets for Moulin Rouge as well as a Seine River Cruise. I would definitely consider staying here again on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Michael134
Reviews.Content: During our recent visit to Paris, we stayed at the Hotel Valadon, on the Left Bank. This hotel is in a lively location, and convenient to the majority of major sights and attractions. Our room was quite clean, roomy by European standards, and the bed and linens are of good quality making for a restful night. While the front desk staff operates from the Hotel du Cadran, across the street, we did not find this to be inconvenient - and the entire staff could not have been more pleasant or helpful. We would definitely consider this hotel on any future visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: michanth
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at Valadon. Room was located on 3rd floor with lift. Small but adequate. Shower was great! Front desk at Caladron were the best. All were helpful. Only advise is when they say to go downstair and help yourself to breakfast, beware it's not included. Of course if we asked we would of not been surprised..LOL. Location was great, just around corner from Rue Cler, walking to Eiffel Tower, Seine river cruise. Great restaurants, shops, markets all within short easy walk.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: draym85
Reviews.Content: This hotel and it's sister, Hotel du Cadran, are both located near rue de Cler. This delightful market street is bustling with charm both day and night. The brasseries, patisseries, and restaurant's in the area make this a great locale to retreat back to after a busy day of sightseeing and shopping. The rooms, although small, are adequate, especially in view of the breakfast area and patio that are available for use. The breakfast provided at the hotel was excellent and a good value. The staff was always helpful beyond what I have come to expect in any urban hotel. This was our second stay and won't be our last.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay will do it again!”
Reviews.Author: fhorton
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic 2 night break with our son (aged 11). The hotel is located near lots of sights and close to metro and bus routes. The hotel service was brilliant and staff speak excellent english. We had to call out a doctor for our son at the end of the first night and the night staff couldn't have been more helpful. They made sure the doctor arrived within an hour and offered to translate for us if needed. Staff also continued to ask after him which I thought was nice. The hotel is quirky, loved the room we stayed in, the upside down room/bathroom was fun and we loved it - very clean and everything we would want. There was also a fridge we could make use of (useful for storing fromage frais and drinks!) The chocolate shop is gorgeous and we were given complimentary macaroons which were luscious and very moreish! I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting somewhere to make a base in Paris for a stay. We are certainly planning to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: ryynoo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Valadon is a great value in a great neighborhood. The staff there is very helpful. They let us keep bags in the baggage room for a week, called us a car for the airport and in general were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully located hotel with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Snasho
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had just had two weeks in Spain then had the 'day from hell' with cancelled and delayed flights in getting to Paris. We arrived at midnight instead of 3pm and the hotel staff were immediately helpful to us. Over the 3 nights we stayed they were always friendly and helpful in answering whatever question we put to them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, everything you could need nearby”
Reviews.Author: jcp07
Reviews.Content: What a find! Hotel Valadon is a 12 room â€œbudgetâ€� hotel with clean, although small, modern rooms on a side street in the Rue Cler area. It is a 5 minute walk from the Lâ€™Ecole Militaire metro stop and a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and the RER station for the train to Versaille. There are markets, shops, and restaurants close by and even a hardware store and a laundromat. Each floor has two rooms. The hotel has a small elevator, which was a definite plus since we were on the top floor. Our room on the back was quiet, even with the window open â€“ and we could see the top of the Eiffel Tower from our window. The free Wi-Fi worked great in the room. They do not want food in the rooms, but there is a dining area on the ground floor with a refrigerator for the guests. The fact that the reception staff is not on site was no problem. Hotel Cadran, which owns the Hotel Valadon and is the place you check in, is just a few steps away. The staff was always helpful and most spoke excellent English. The adjoining shop has beautiful macaroons. If you want to try some, be sure to learn the shop hours. It was always closed when we were around. Instead of breakfast at the Hotel Cadran, we ate at neighborhood restaurants and enjoyed watching a little bit of Parisian life as parents walked their children to school. We would definitely stay at the Hotel Valadon again.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lethal2650
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights in October and we really enjoyed our stay there. We had an attic room facing the street. The room was reasonably quiet, although with an open window there was some noise from late night revellers in the street. The view was not great just other Paris rooftops. This hotel is located near to a Metro station although we found we could walk to most places from the hotel. It is less than 10 minutes from the Eiffel Tower and close to the Rodin Museum and other major attractions. The room was clean, plenty of room, extremely comfortable and with free wi fi. Staff were extremely friendly and most obliging. They are situated 50 metres from the hotel in the Hotel Cadran. There is no breakfast at the Valadon but it is available at the Cadran. We did not have breakfast at the Cadran as there are numerous cafes within about 150 metres of the Hotel. There is a small two person lift which is useful if you are in at attic room. I would certainly stay in this Hotel again
